fnm_a: #fnm_intro# I had just #fnm_wentto# #fnm_restaurant# and ordered #fnm_restaurantorder#. So in #fnm_walks# #fnm_contact# - looking for me as usual. Turns out #fnm_victim# got #fnm_killed#. #fnm_weapon#. #fnm_time#
fnm_intro: This one could bring the #fnm_nth# Precinct to its knees, and maybe the whole city down with it.
It was a crisp day, and the breeze was stiff and brisk.  Leaves mingled with trash as they blew through the alleys and side streets.
It was brisk.  The wind blew right through your jacket like it was a seive.
It was blustery out.  The snow was coming in sideways, hard.  It had only been a few hours and the streets were already a cold, brown mush.
It was what folks call the dead of winter.  The dirt had mixed with the ice and snow until the alleys were plastered in a crunchy, gritty brown.
It was freezing.  I nearly slipped on the ice outside the door.
It was bitterly cold out on the streets... at least the wind had died down for the moment.
Snow.  Since when the hell did it snow around here?  And it was coming down in buckets.
It was cold out.  So cold it even drove the beggars inside.  My gloves stuck to the door handle for a moment as I was getting out of #fnm_thecar#.
It was a dark and stormy night.
It was a bad week in a bad month; maybe even a bad year.  The Times were calling it the worst crime spike the city had ever seen.
It was a dark day in the big city.  Normal for this time of year, but something felt darker today... something more sinister.
It was a cool, black night.  The night stuck to you like it was something real; some black, tangible fabric made of smoke, deceit, and murder.
So there I was.
Rain.  Hard, drumming, pounding rain.  It'd been coming down for hours.
It was raining; the kind of rain that you'd hope would just clean the filth right off the streets.
The air was cool and moist downtown, and the clouds were heavy-laden and ripe with rain.
The smog mixed with the muggy air and it was stifling.  I wanted to get out of town like a rat leaving a sinking ship, but there was some pressing business to attend to.
The air was heavy in the big city; the heat roiling off the pavement was stifling.
I remember it like it was yesterday.
I remember this one case... I was fresh on the Force.  Had a thin mustache and a thinner wallet... but even back then I had a sharp nose for hot leads.
It was a few years back.  I had just gotten on the Force.
I remember when I was still just a rookie, just another gumshoe bumbling his way through the concrete jungle.
It was an oppressively hot day in the city.  The blacktop was baking, and the broads on #fnm_nth# and Main were wearing even less than usual.
It was as hot as I'd ever remembered it.  Just blistering.  You could cook breakfast right on the sidewalk; that is, if you could bear to eat off of the filthiest imaginable surface on earth.
It was a heat wave; worst in years.  Scalding, scorching, sweltering heat... it was so hot the newsies had gone on strike.  Hell, even the thermometers had gone on strike... about 20 degrees ago.
Well, this is how it all went down.
Listen... it started like this.
It was another one of those days.
The lights, the smoke, the grime, the city itself... seemed to be alive that day.
fnm_thecar: a car left unlocked and parked on the street
fnm_wentto: checked in with a friend who was over at
fnm_restaurant: the filthiest dive bar this side of the river
fnm_restaurantorder: a cup of sour, scalding hot coffee
a hot ham and swiss on rye
a jar of ice-cold pickle juice
a double helping of the Moist Mystery Meat Special
the saddest hamburger ever laid eyes on
the saddest green salad I've ever laid eyes on
the saddest French onion soup I've ever seen
a martini that would make an alcoholic wince
a piping hot cup of coffee
a glass of festering, room-temperature, unpasteurized milk
a slice of pie and a cup of coffee
some cold coffee and colder toast
a cup of coffee and some dry white toast
four whole fried chickens and a coke
a double-deluxe triple-bacon quadruple-layer meat mountain with everything
a triple-deluxe double-bacon meat pile with extra dirty sauce
a triple-double big-and-nasty with dirty cheese fingers
blueberry pie and an upside-down cappacino
stale donuts and day-old coffee warmed up in the microwave
something to take the edge off
something to ease away the troubles
something to make me numb to warm and cold
something to help me forget about the night before
something to help me forget about the Cubs
something strong, something to make sure I won't be back there the next night
fnm_shadycontact: with the nose hair that goes everywhere
with the big tuft of ear hairs that sprout out sideways
who whistles out of that missing front tooth
with the big scar down the cheek
fnm_killed: sent to the bottom of a lake
sent to be bagged and tagged
set up for a hot date at the Coroner's Office
fnm_weapon: Found #fnm_murderweapon.a# near the body with clear signs of a struggle.

They found #fnm_murderweapon.a# and lifted a few clean prints off of it.

The body had more holes in it than Roosevelt's economic plan

Small-caliber rifle, according to the lab
Boys at the lab say it was done with a small-caliber revolver
Seems a large-caliber rifle was involved
Found shells from a very large-caliber revolver nearby
The body was cut into neat little pieces
The body had been quartered by a butcher knife

The victim's fingers had been chopped off to prevent identification; they had to use dental records

Turns out the victim's flask stopped the first bullet cold - but their head didn't do such a good job on the second one

Whoever did it tried to bury the evidence, but got spooked before they could finish the job

Body had lots of issues - drugs, #fnm_2d4# stab wounds, and the face looked like it took a shotgun shell at point-blank range

Had a single bullet wound through the base of the neck, execution-style

Seems there was a struggle, and they were strangled to death
Seems there was a struggle, and they were asphyxiated
Looks like they were knocked out then dragged for a while
There was a formaldehyde-soaked cloth under the body
It looked like they managed to fight back - a bloody trail led out the window
The scene was a damn bloodbath.  Took four hours just to scrape together something for identification
They put up a fight.  Most of the blood in the room came from somebody else
They managed to fight back - a bloody trail led all the way down the alley
Guess they still had some vinegar in them - seems one of the attackers' ears got torn off in the struggle
The victim's pistol was found nearby, seems they tried to put up a fight
The victim's shotgun and several empty shells were found nearby
The victim had unloaded two pistols on the attackers, and there was blood everywhere at the scene

The lab says they were poisoned
It looked like a set-up; they were attacked from several angles
They were found drowned in their own bathtub

They were killed in an elevator like a fish in a barrel

fnm_time: #fnm_happened# just last night. "#fnm_anotherone#" I thought out loud.
#fnm_happened# within the past 24 hours. I briefly glanced out the window, then loaded my #fnm_gun#. The rounds found their way home with a satisfying click.
#fnm_happened# just yesterday. "#fnm_anotherone#" I thought out loud, grabbing my #fnm_gun#.
#fnm_happened# not more than an hour ago. "#fnm_anotherone#" I thought out loud, loading my #fnm_gun#.
#fnm_happened# earlier that week. "#fnm_anotherone#" I muttered to myself.
#fnm_happened# last Thursday.  I jotted down the details and got ready for a grisly new case.
#fnm_happened# just a few hours ago. No suspects as of yet. "#fnm_anotherone#" I muttered.
#fnm_happened# early in the morning. I dusted off my jacket, lit up my last cigar, grabbed my hat and walked out. "#fnm_anotherone#" I said, shaking my head on my way out the door.
